   22: -module(dtls_api_SUITE).
   23: 
   24: %% Callback functions
   25: -export([all/0,
   26:          groups/0,
   27:          init_per_suite/1,
   28:          end_per_suite/1,
   29:          init_per_group/2,
   30:          end_per_group/2,
   31:          init_per_testcase/2,
   32:          end_per_testcase/2]).
   33: 
   34: %% Testcases
   35: -export([
   36:          replay_window/0, replay_window/1,
   37:          dtls_listen_owner_dies/0,
   38:          dtls_listen_owner_dies/1,
   39:          dtls_listen_close/0,
   40:          dtls_listen_close/1,
   41:          dtls_listen_reopen/0,
   42:          dtls_listen_reopen/1,
   43:          dtls_listen_both_family/0,
   44:          dtls_listen_both_family/1,
   45:          dtls_listen_two_sockets_1/0,
   46:          dtls_listen_two_sockets_1/1,
   47:          dtls_listen_two_sockets_2/0,
   48:          dtls_listen_two_sockets_2/1,
   49:          dtls_listen_two_sockets_3/0,
   50:          dtls_listen_two_sockets_3/1,
   51:          dtls_listen_two_sockets_4/0,
   52:          dtls_listen_two_sockets_4/1,
   53:          dtls_listen_two_sockets_5/0,
   54:          dtls_listen_two_sockets_5/1,
   55:          dtls_listen_two_sockets_6/0,
   56:          dtls_listen_two_sockets_6/1,
   57:          client_restarts/0, client_restarts/1,
   58:          client_restarts_multiple_acceptors/1
   59:         ]).
   60: 
   61: -include("ssl_test_lib.hrl").
   62: -include_lib("ssl/src/ssl_internal.hrl").
   63: -include_lib("ssl/src/ssl_api.hrl").
   64: 
   65: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   66: %% Common Test interface functions -----------------------------------
   67: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   68: all() ->
   69:     [
   70:      replay_window,
   71:      {group, 'dtlsv1.2'},
   72:      {group, 'dtlsv1'}
   73:     ].
   74: 
   75: groups() ->
   76:     [
   77:      {'dtlsv1.2', [],  api_tests()},
   78:      {'dtlsv1', [],  api_tests()}
   79:     ].
   80: 
   81: api_tests() ->
   82:     [
   83:      dtls_listen_owner_dies,
   84:      dtls_listen_close,
   85:      dtls_listen_reopen,
   86:      dtls_listen_both_family,
   87:      dtls_listen_two_sockets_1,
   88:      dtls_listen_two_sockets_2,
   89:      dtls_listen_two_sockets_3,
   90:      dtls_listen_two_sockets_4,
   91:      dtls_listen_two_sockets_5,
   92:      dtls_listen_two_sockets_6,
   93:      client_restarts,
   94:      client_restarts_multiple_acceptors
   95:     ].
   96: 
   97: init_per_suite(Config0) ->
   98:     catch crypto:stop(),
   99:     try crypto:start() of
  100: 	ok ->
  101: 	    ssl_test_lib:clean_start(),
  102: 	    ssl_test_lib:make_rsa_cert(Config0)
  103:     catch _:_ ->
  104: 	    {skip, "Crypto did not start"}
  105:     end.
  106: 
  107: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
  108:     ssl:stop(),
  109:     application:unload(ssl),
  110:     application:stop(crypto).
  111: 
  112: 
  113: init_per_group(GroupName, Config) ->
  114:     ssl_test_lib:init_per_group(GroupName, Config).
  115: 
  116: end_per_group(GroupName, Config) ->
  117:     ssl_test_lib:end_per_group(GroupName, Config).
  118: 
  119: init_per_testcase(Testcase, Config)
  120:   when Testcase =:= dtls_listen_two_sockets_1 orelse
  121:        Testcase =:= dtls_listen_two_sockets_5 orelse
  122:        Testcase =:= dtls_listen_two_sockets_6 ->
  123:     case ssl:listen(0, [{protocol, dtls}, {ip, {127,0,0,2}}]) of
  124:         {ok, S} ->
  125:             test_listen_on_all_interfaces(S, Config),
  126:             ssl:close(S),
  127:             ssl_test_lib:ct_log_supported_protocol_versions(Config),
  128:             ct:timetrap({seconds, 10}),
  129:             maybe_skip_tc_on_windows(Testcase, Config);
  130:         {error, _} ->
  131:             {skip, "127.0.0.x address not available"}
  132:     end;
  133: init_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
  134:     ssl_test_lib:ct_log_supported_protocol_versions(Config),
  135:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 10}),
  136:     Config.
  137: 
  138: end_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->     
  139:     Config.
  140: 
  141: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  142: %% Test Cases --------------------------------------------------------
  143: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  144: 
  145: dtls_listen_owner_dies() ->
  146:     [{doc, "Test that you can start new DTLS 'listener' if old owner dies"}].
  147: 
  148: dtls_listen_owner_dies(Config) when is_list(Config) ->    
  149:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
  150:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  151:     {_, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  152: 
  153:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(ServerNode),
  154:     {Pid, Ref} = spawn_monitor(fun() -> {ok, _} =
  155:                                             ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls} | ServerOpts]),
  156:                                         [_] = listener_and_ports(),
  157:                                         {error, _} = ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls} | ServerOpts])
  158:                                end),
  159:     receive
  160:         {'DOWN', Ref, _, Pid, _} ->
  161:             ok
  162:     end,
  163:     [] = listener_and_ports(),   %% Verify that ports are cleaned up after listener owner dies
  164:     {ok, LSocket} = ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls} | ServerOpts]),
  165:     [_] = listener_and_ports(),
  166:     spawn(fun() ->
  167:                   {ok, ASocket} = ssl:transport_accept(LSocket),
  168:                   {ok, Socket} = ssl:handshake(ASocket),
  169:                   receive
  170:                       {ssl, Socket, "from client"} ->
  171:                           ssl:send(Socket, "from server"),
  172:                           ssl:close(Socket)
  173:                   end
  174:           end),
  175:     {ok, Client} = ssl:connect(Hostname, Port, ClientOpts),
  176: 
  177:     ssl:send(Client, "from client"),
  178:     receive
  179:         {ssl, Client, "from server"} ->
  180:             ssl:close(Client)
  181:     end.
  182: 
  183: dtls_listen_close() ->
  184:     [{doc, "Test that you close a DTLS 'listener' socket"}].
  185: 
  186: dtls_listen_close(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  187:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  188:     {_, ServerNode, _Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  189: 
  190:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(ServerNode),
  191:     {ok, ListenSocket} = ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls} | ServerOpts]),
  192:     [_] = listener_and_ports(),
  193:     ok = ssl:close(ListenSocket),
  194:     [] = listener_and_ports(),
  195:     {ok, ListenSocket2} = ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls} | ServerOpts]),
  196:     [_] = listener_and_ports(),
  197:     ok = ssl:close(ListenSocket2, 500),
  198:     [] = listener_and_ports(),
  199:     ok.
  200: 
  201: dtls_listen_reopen() ->
  202:     [{doc, "Test that you close a DTLS 'listner' socket and open a new one for the same port"}].
  203: 
  204: dtls_listen_reopen(Config) when is_list(Config) -> 
  205:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_verify_opts, Config),
  206:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  207:     {_, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  208: 
  209:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(ServerNode),
  210:     {ok, LSocket0} = ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls} | ServerOpts]),
  211:      spawn(fun() ->
  212:                   {ok, ASocket} = ssl:transport_accept(LSocket0),
  213:                    {ok, Socket} = ssl:handshake(ASocket),
  214:                    receive
  215:                        {ssl, Socket, "from client"} ->
  216:                            ssl:send(Socket, "from server 1"),
  217:                            ssl:close(Socket)
  218:                    end
  219:            end),
  220:     {ok, Client1} = ssl:connect(Hostname, Port, ClientOpts),
  221:     ok = ssl:close(LSocket0),
  222:     {ok, LSocket1} = ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls} | ServerOpts]),
  223:     spawn(fun() ->
  224:                   {ok, ASocket} = ssl:transport_accept(LSocket1),
  225:                   {ok, Socket} = ssl:handshake(ASocket),
  226:                   receive
  227:                       {ssl, Socket, "from client"} ->
  228:                           ssl:send(Socket, "from server 2"),
  229:                           ssl:close(Socket)
  230:                    end
  231:           end),
  232:     {ok, Client2} = ssl:connect(Hostname, Port, [{protocol, dtls} | ClientOpts]),
  233:     ssl:send(Client2, "from client"),
  234:     ssl:send(Client1, "from client"),
  235:     receive
  236:         {ssl, Client1, "from server 1"} ->
  237:             ssl:close(Client1)
  238:     end,
  239:     receive
  240:         {ssl, Client2, "from server 2"} ->
  241:             ssl:close(Client2)
  242:     end.
  243: 
  244: dtls_listen_both_family() ->
  245:     [].
  246: %%    [{require, ipv6_hosts}].
  247: dtls_listen_both_family(Config) ->
  248:     {ok, Hostname0} = inet:gethostname(),
  249: 
  250:     TestIPV6 = case ct:get_config(ipv6_hosts) of
  251:                   Hosts when is_list(Hosts) ->
  252:                       lists:member(list_to_atom(Hostname0), Hosts);
  253:                   undefined ->
  254:                       ct:log("Local tests (ipv6 probably works)", []),
  255:                       true
  256:               end,
  257:     case TestIPV6 of
  258:         true ->
  259:             {_, ServerNode, _Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  260:             Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(ServerNode),
  261:             {ok, ListenSocket} = ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls}]),
  262:             [_] = listener_and_ports(),
  263: 
  264:             {ok, ListenSocketIpV6} = ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls}, inet6, {ipv6_v6only,true}]),
  265:             [_,_] = listener_and_ports(),
  266: 
  267:             ok = ssl:close(ListenSocket),
  268:             ok = ssl:close(ListenSocketIpV6);
  269:         false ->
  270:             {skip, "Host does not support IPv6"}
  271:     end.
  272: 
  273: dtls_listen_two_sockets_1() ->
  274:     [{doc, "Test with two DTLS dockets: 127.0.0.2:Port, 127.0.0.3:Port"}].
  275: dtls_listen_two_sockets_1(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
  276:     {ok, S1} = ssl:listen(0, [{protocol, dtls}, {ip, {127,0,0,2}}]),
  277:     {ok, {_, Port}} = ssl:sockname(S1),
  278:     {ok, S2} = ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls}, {ip, {127,0,0,3}}]),
  279:     ssl:close(S1),
  280:     ssl:close(S2),
  281:     ok.
  282: 
  283: dtls_listen_two_sockets_2() ->
  284:     [{doc, "Test with two DTLS dockets: <all_interfaces>:Port, <all_interfaces>:Port"}].
  285: dtls_listen_two_sockets_2(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
  286:     {ok, S1} = ssl:listen(0, [{protocol, dtls}]),
  287:     {ok, {_, Port}} = ssl:sockname(S1),
  288:     {error, already_listening} =
  289:         ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls}]),
  290:     ssl:close(S1),
  291:     ok.
  292: 
  293: dtls_listen_two_sockets_3() ->
  294:     [{doc, "Test with two DTLS dockets: <all_interfaces>:Port, <all_interfaces>:Port"}].
  295: dtls_listen_two_sockets_3(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
  296:     {ok, S1} = ssl:listen(0, [{protocol, dtls}]),
  297:     {ok, {_, Port}} = ssl:sockname(S1),
  298:     {error, already_listening} =
  299:         ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls}]),
  300:     ssl:close(S1),
  301:     {ok, S2} = ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls}]),
  302:     ssl:close(S2),
  303:     ok.
  304: 
  305: dtls_listen_two_sockets_4() ->
  306:   [{doc, "Test with two DTLS dockets: process1 - <all_interfaces>:Port, process2 - <all_interfaces>:Port"}].
  307: dtls_listen_two_sockets_4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
  308:     Test = self(),
  309:     Pid = spawn(fun() ->
  310:                   {ok, S1} = ssl:listen(0, [{protocol, dtls}]),
  311:                   {ok, {_, Port0}} = ssl:sockname(S1),
  312:                   Test ! {self(), Port0}
  313:                 end),
  314:     Port =
  315:         receive
  316:             {Pid, Port1} ->
  317:                 Port1
  318:         end,
  319:     {ok, S2} =
  320:         ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls}]),
  321:     ssl:close(S2),
  322:     ok.
  323: 
  324: dtls_listen_two_sockets_5() ->
  325:     [{doc, "Test with two DTLS dockets: <all_interfaces>:Port, 127.0.0.3:Port"}].
  326: dtls_listen_two_sockets_5(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
  327:     {ok, S1} = ssl:listen(0, [{protocol, dtls}]),
  328:     {ok, {_, Port}} = ssl:sockname(S1),
  329:     {error, already_listening} =
  330:         ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls}, {ip, {127,0,0,3}}]),
  331:     ssl:close(S1),
  332:     {ok, S2} =
  333:         ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls}, {ip, {127,0,0,3}}]),
  334:     {error, already_listening} =
  335:         ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls}]),
  336:     ssl:close(S2),
  337:     ok.
  338: 
  339: dtls_listen_two_sockets_6() ->
  340:     [{doc, "Test with two DTLS dockets: 127.0.0.3:Port, 0.0.0.0:Port"}].
  341: dtls_listen_two_sockets_6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
  342:     {ok, S1} = ssl:listen(0, [{protocol, dtls}, {ip, {127,0,0,3}}]),
  343:     {ok, {_, Port}} = ssl:sockname(S1),
  344:     {error, already_listening} =
  345:         ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls}, {ip, {0,0,0,0}}]),
  346:     ssl:close(S1),
  347:     ok.
  348: 
  349: listener_and_ports() ->
  350:     timer:sleep(200), %% Allow some time to start och delete dead children
  351:     Pids = [Pid || {_, Pid, _, _} <- supervisor:which_children(dtls_listener_sup)],
  352:     PidPorts = [{element(2, erlang:port_info(P, connected)), P}
  353:                 || P <- erlang:ports(), {name, "udp_inet"} == erlang:port_info(P, name)],
  354:     PidWithoutPort = [Pid || Pid <- Pids, not lists:keymember(Pid, 1, PidPorts)],
  355:     PidPorts ++ PidWithoutPort.
  356: 
  357: replay_window() ->
  358:     [{doc, "Whitebox test of replay window"}].
  359: replay_window(_Config) ->
  360:     W0 = dtls_record:init_replay_window(),
  361:     Size = 58,
  362:     true = replay_window(0, 0, Size-1, [], W0),
  363:     ok.
  364: 
  365: replay_window(N, Top, Sz, Used, W0) when N < 99000 ->
  366:     Bottom = max(0, Top - Sz),
  367:     Seq = max(0, Bottom + rand:uniform(Top-Bottom+10)-5),
  368:     IsReplay = (Seq < Bottom) orelse lists:member(Seq, Used),
  369:     case dtls_record:is_replay(Seq,W0) of
  370:         true when IsReplay ->
  371:             replay_window(N+1, Top, Sz, Used, W0);
  372:         false when (not IsReplay) ->
  373:             #{replay_window:=W1} = dtls_record:update_replay_window(Seq, #{replay_window=>W0}),
  374:             NewTop = if Seq > Top -> Seq;
  375:                         true -> Top
  376:                      end,
  377:             NewBottom = max(0, (NewTop - Sz)),
  378:             NewUsed = lists:dropwhile(fun(S) -> S < NewBottom end,
  379:                                       lists:sort([Seq|Used])),
  380:             replay_window(N+1, NewTop, Sz, NewUsed, W1);
  381:         Replay ->
  382:             io:format("Try: ~p Top: ~w Sz: ~p Used:~p State: ~w~n", [N, Top, Sz, length(Used), W0]),
  383:             io:format("Seq: ~w Replay: ~p (~p)~n ~w~n ~w~n",
  384:                       [Seq, Replay, IsReplay, Used, bits_to_list(W0)]),
  385:             {fail, Replay, Seq, W0}
  386:     end;
  387: replay_window(N, Top, Sz, Used, W0) ->
  388:     io:format("Try: ~p Top: ~w Sz: ~p Used:~p State: ~w~n", [N, Top, Sz, length(Used), W0]),
  389:     io:format("Match ~w ~n", [bits_to_list(W0) =:= Used]),
  390:     bits_to_list(W0) =:= Used.
  391: 
  392: bits_to_list(#{mask := Bits, bottom:= Bottom}) ->
  393:     bits_to_list(Bits, Bottom, []).
  394: 
  395: bits_to_list(0, _, Is) ->
  396:     lists:reverse(Is);
  397: bits_to_list(Bits, I, Acc) ->
  398:     case Bits band 1 of
  399:         1 -> bits_to_list(Bits bsr 1, I+1, [I|Acc]);
  400:         0 -> bits_to_list(Bits bsr 1, I+1, Acc)
  401:     end.
  402: 
  403: client_restarts() ->
  404:     [{doc, "Test re-connection "}].
  405: 
  406: client_restarts(Config) ->
  407:     ClientOpts0 = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_verify_opts, Config),
  408:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_verify_opts, Config),
  409:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  410: 
  411:     ClientOpts = [{verify, verify_none},{reuse_sessions, save} | ClientOpts0],
  412:     Server =
  413: 	ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  414: 				   {from, self()},
  415:                                    {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, no_result, []}},
  416: 				   {options, [{verify, verify_none}|ServerOpts]}]),
  417:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  418:     Client0 = ssl_test_lib:start_client([{node, ClientNode},
  419:                                          {port, Port}, {host, Hostname},
  420:                                          {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, no_result, []}},
  421:                                          {from, self()},
  422:                                          {options, ClientOpts}]),
  423: 
  424:     ssl_test_lib:send(Client0, Msg1 = "from client 0"),
  425:     ssl_test_lib:send(Server, Msg2 = "from server to client 0"),
  426: 
  427:     Server ! {active_receive, Msg1},
  428:     Client0 ! {active_receive, Msg2},
  429: 
  430:     Msgs = lists:sort([{Server, Msg1}, {Client0, Msg2}]),
  431:     Msgs = lists:sort(flush()),
  432: 
  433:     ReConnect =  %% Whitebox re-connect test
  434:         fun(#sslsocket{connection_cb = dtls_gen_connection,
  435:                        connection_handler = Pid} = Socket, ssl) ->
  436:                 ?CT_LOG("Client Socket: ~p ~n", [Socket]),
  437:                 {ok, IntSocket} = gen_statem:call(Pid, {downgrade, self()}),
  438:                 {{Address,CPort},UDPSocket}=IntSocket,
  439:                 ?CT_LOG("Info: ~p~n", [inet:info(UDPSocket)]),
  440: 
  441:                 {ok, #config{transport_info = CbInfo, connection_cb = ConnectionCb,
  442:                              ssl = SslOpts0}} =
  443:                     ssl:handle_options(ClientOpts, client, Address),
  444:                 SslOpts = {SslOpts0, #socket_options{}, undefined},
  445: 
  446:                 ct:sleep(250),
  447:                 ?CT_LOG("Client second connect: ~p ~p~n", [Socket, CbInfo]),
  448:                 {ok, NewSocket} = ssl_gen_statem:connect(ConnectionCb, Address, CPort, IntSocket,
  449:                                                          SslOpts, self(), CbInfo, infinity),
  450:                 {replace, NewSocket}
  451:         end,
  452: 
  453:     Client0 ! {apply, self(), ReConnect},
  454:     receive
  455:         {apply_res, {replace, Res}} ->
  456:             ?CT_LOG("Apply res: ~p~n", [Res]),
  457:             ok;
  458:         ErrMsg ->
  459:             ?CT_LOG("Unhandled: ~p~n", [ErrMsg]),
  460:             ct:fail({wrong_msg, ErrMsg})
  461:     end,
  462: 
  463:     ssl_test_lib:send(Client0, Msg1 = "from client 0"),
  464:     ssl_test_lib:send(Server, Msg2 = "from server to client 0"),
  465: 
  466:     Server ! {active_receive, Msg1},
  467:     Client0 ! {active_receive, Msg2},
  468: 
  469:     Msgs = lists:sort(flush()),
  470: 
  471:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server),
  472:     ssl_test_lib:close(Client0),
  473:     ok.
  474: 
  475: 
  476: flush() ->
  477:     receive Msg -> [Msg|flush()]
  478:     after 500 -> []
  479:     end.
  480: 
  481: client_restarts_multiple_acceptors(Config) ->
  482:     %% Can also be tested with openssl by connecting a client and hit
  483:     %% Ctrl-C to kill openssl process, so that the connection is not
  484:     %% closed.
  485:     %% Then do a new openssl connect with the same client port.
  486: 
  487:     ClientOpts0 = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_verify_opts, Config),
  488:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_verify_opts, Config),
  489:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  490: 
  491:     ClientOpts = [{verify, verify_none},{reuse_sessions, save} | ClientOpts0],
  492:     Server =
  493: 	ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  494: 				   {from, self()},
  495:                                    {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, no_result, []}},
  496:                                    {accepters, 2},
  497: 				   {options, [{verify, verify_none}|ServerOpts]}]),
  498:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  499:     Client0 = ssl_test_lib:start_client([{node, ClientNode},
  500:                                          {port, Port}, {host, Hostname},
  501:                                          {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, no_result, []}},
  502:                                          {from, self()},
  503:                                          {options, ClientOpts}]),
  504: 
  505:     Server2 = receive {accepter, 2, Server2Pid} -> Server2Pid
  506:               after 5000 -> ct:fail(msg_timeout)
  507:               end,
  508: 
  509:     ssl_test_lib:send(Client0, Msg1 = "from client 0"),
  510:     ssl_test_lib:send(Server, Msg2 = "from server to client 0"),
  511: 
  512:     Server ! {active_receive, Msg1},
  513:     Client0 ! {active_receive, Msg2},
  514: 
  515:     Msgs = lists:sort([{Server, Msg1}, {Client0, Msg2}]),
  516:     Msgs = lists:sort(flush()),
  517: 
  518:     ReConnect =  %% Whitebox re-connect test
  519:         fun(#sslsocket{connection_cb = dtls_gen_connection,
  520:                         connection_handler = Pid} = Socket, ssl) ->
  521:                 ?CT_LOG("Client Socket: ~p ~n", [Socket]),
  522:                 {ok, IntSocket} = gen_statem:call(Pid, {downgrade, self()}),
  523:                 {{Address,CPort},UDPSocket}=IntSocket,
  524:                 ?CT_LOG("Info: ~p~n", [inet:info(UDPSocket)]),
  525: 
  526:                 {ok, #config{transport_info = CbInfo, connection_cb = ConnectionCb,
  527:                              ssl = SslOpts0}} =
  528:                     ssl:handle_options(ClientOpts, client, Address),
  529:                 SslOpts = {SslOpts0, #socket_options{}, undefined},
  530: 
  531:                 ct:sleep(250),
  532:                 ?CT_LOG("Client second connect: ~p ~p~n", [Socket, CbInfo]),
  533:                 {ok, NewSocket} = ssl_gen_statem:connect(ConnectionCb, Address, CPort, IntSocket,
  534:                                                          SslOpts, self(), CbInfo, infinity),
  535:                 {replace, NewSocket}
  536:         end,
  537: 
  538:     Client0 ! {apply, self(), ReConnect},
  539:     receive
  540:         {apply_res, {replace, Res}} ->
  541:             ?CT_LOG("Apply res: ~p~n", [Res]),
  542:             ok;
  543:         ErrMsg ->
  544:             ?CT_LOG("Unhandled: ~p~n", [ErrMsg]),
  545:             ct:fail({wrong_msg, ErrMsg})
  546:     end,
  547: 
  548:     ok = ssl_test_lib:send(Client0, Msg3 = "from client 2"),
  549:     ok = ssl_test_lib:send(Server2, Msg4 = "from server 2 to client 2"),
  550:     {error, closed} = ssl_test_lib:send(Server,  "Should be closed"),
  551: 
  552:     Msgs2 = lists:sort([{Server2, Msg3}, {Client0, Msg4}]),
  553: 
  554:     Server2 ! {active_receive, Msg3},
  555:     Client0 ! {active_receive, Msg4},
  556: 
  557:     Msgs2 = lists:sort(flush()),
  558: 
  559:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server),
  560:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server2),
  561:     ssl_test_lib:close(Client0),
  562:     ok.
  563: 
  564: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  565: %% Internal functions ------------------------------------------------
  566: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  567: 
  568: %% Helper function for init_per_testcase.
  569: test_listen_on_all_interfaces(S0, Config) ->
  570:     {ok, {_, Port}} = ssl:sockname(S0),
  571:     case ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls}, {ip, {0,0,0,0}}]) of
  572:         {ok, S1} ->
  573:             ssl:close(S0),
  574:             ssl:close(S1),
  575:             {skip, "Testcase is not supported on this OS."};
  576:         {error, _} ->
  577:             Config
  578:     end.
  579: 
  580: maybe_skip_tc_on_windows(Testcase, Config)
  581:   when Testcase =:= dtls_listen_two_sockets_5 orelse
  582:        Testcase =:= dtls_listen_two_sockets_6 ->
  583:     case os:type() of
  584:         {win32, _} ->
  585:             {skip, "Testcase not supported in Windows"};
  586:         _ ->
  587:             Config
  588:     end;
  589: maybe_skip_tc_on_windows(_, Config) ->
  590:     Config.
